title: "What is the Occidental Character of Christianity and its Relationship to the Western Tradition?"
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, the author discusses the misconception that Christianity is Western in origin and character. They argue that while the majority of Christians may reside in the West, Christianity itself cannot be considered a Western religion. The author points out that Christianity's origins are not tied to any one region, and its universality is not a justification for labeling it as Western. Rather, it is the West that has become Christian over time. The author sheds light on this fact to dispel the dominant confusion surrounding this issue.
